intro: Babiana longicollis, commonly known as the long-necked babiana, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in grassland habitats and prefers well-drained soils. Its bulbs are adapted for storing water and nutrients, allowing it to survive in dry conditions. The flowers are often visited by pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance.
